page.title: 06HARPER ADAMS WEATHER STATION
page.content: The station was set-up in l903 and financed by the{Ministry of {Agriculture}as an advisory service for arable farmers and for research into the effects of weather on crops. It is the longest established of the eight weather stations in Shropshire. Recordings taken daily at precisely 9.00am are sent to the{Meteorological {Office}at Bracknell where they, with recordings from all the other stations nationwide,are computed,meteorologists compare patterns and predict weather by establishing a trend after studying recordings taken over several years in a specific period. Instruments used include a Rain Gauge, a Sunshine Indicator, a Weather Vane and 7 thermometers. The highest temperature recorded was 85.5F and on 10/1/82 at -26.1C Edgmond was the coldest place in England.
